claim.text: The benchmark Vanilla LLM model, which uses basic financial metrics, demonstrates stronger performance than traditional analyst evaluations when assessed by forward returns.
claim.exact_quote: The benchmark Vanilla LLM model, which uses basic financial metrics, demonstrates stronger performance than traditional analyst evaluations when assessed by forward returns.

evidence.evidence_text: The benchmark Vanilla LLM model, which uses basic financial metrics, demonstrates stronger performance than traditional analyst evaluations when assessed by forward returns.
evidence.exact_quote: The Vanilla method has a lower MAE of 1.447 compared to the Analyst predictions, which has a Return MAE of 1.570.

conclusion.key_limitations: The study only uses forward returns for evaluation, which might not capture all aspects of performance.

claim.text: The Fundamental LLMs outperformed all experiments, highlighting the significant impact of financial fundamentals on prediction accuracy. Additionally, combining sentiment scores with this data, without the full news summaries, further improved prediction accuracy.
claim.exact_quote: The Fundamental LLMs outperformed all experiments, highlighting the significant impact of financial fundamentals on prediction accuracy. Additionally, combining sentiment scores with this data, without the full news summaries, further improved prediction accuracy.

evidence.evidence_text: The Fundamental LLMs outperformed all experiments, highlighting the significant impact of financial fundamentals on prediction accuracy. Additionally, combining sentiment scores with this data, without the full news summaries, further improved prediction accuracy.
evidence.exact_quote: The Fundamentals + Sentiment experiment has the best performance in terms of Return MAE, with a value of 1.417, indicating the most accurate predictions.

conclusion.key_limitations: The study does not consider other qualitative factors that analysts might consider.

claim.text: Integrating news summaries and sentiment analysis provides some short-term predictive benefits but does not significantly improve long-term prediction accuracy when compared to the Vanilla model.
claim.exact_quote: Integrating news summaries and sentiment analysis provides some short-term predictive benefits but does not significantly improve long-term prediction accuracy when compared to the Vanilla model.

evidence.evidence_text: Integrating news summaries and sentiment analysis provides some short-term predictive benefits but does not significantly improve long-term prediction accuracy when compared to the Vanilla model.
evidence.exact_quote: The News (Summary) experiment performs best in the 1-month period, outperforming all other experiments in both Return and Sector MAE.

conclusion.key_limitations: The study does not consider the impact of other data sources over longer periods.

claim.text: The performance difference between adding news as text versus news sentiment to the LLM is very small when other data is not included (i.e. Fundamentals), indicating that both approaches offer similar benefits.
claim.exact_quote: The performance difference between adding news as text versus news sentiment to the LLM is very small when other data is not included (i.e. Fundamentals), indicating that both approaches offer similar benefits.
